Entities.Name: ClinicalQuery
Entities.Definition: Clinical query that indicates the presence or suspicion of an invasive fungal infection (IFI).

Entities.Name: FungalDescriptor
Entities.Definition: Descriptors suggesting the presence of fungal organisms, often descriptive morphological terms.

Entities.Name: Invasiveness
Entities.Definition: Phrases describing fungal invasion into tissues or structures.

Entities.Name: Stain
Entities.Definition: Names of histological stains used to detect fungal elements.

Entities.Name: SampleType
Entities.Definition: Tissue source or sampled organ from which the specimen was taken.

Entities.Name: Positive
Entities.Definition: Affirmative expressions indicating the presence of IFI or a concept.

Entities.Name: Equivocal
Entities.Definition: Phrases expressing diagnostic uncertainty or ambiguity.
Entities.SampleData: features may be consistent with fungal infection

Entities.Name: Negative
Entities.Definition: Expressions explicitly negating the presence of IFI or its features.

Dataset.Name: CHIFIR (Cytology and Histopathology Invasive Fungal Infection Reports)
Dataset.Description: A corpus of 283 clinical cytology and histopathology reports from 201 patients, annotated for IFI concepts. Developed to support research on fungal infection detection.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Entities were annotated to capture concepts relevant to IFI diagnosis. Terms were labeled based on their context in pathology reports. The CRF model used token-level features including capitalization, prefixes/suffixes, hyphenation, and context windows. Labels were assigned at the token level using BIO tagging, then aggregated into full spans.
